newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch Rabobank denies Kredietbank alliance report.
newsitem.headline: Dutch Rabobank denies Kredietbank alliance report.

text.p: Dutch co-operative bank Rabobank on Thursday denied a report it was holding talks with Belgium's Kredietbank on forging a close alliance similar to that of the Belgo-Dutch Fortis group.

But Rabobank spokesman Ruud de Kort said Rabobank and Kredietbank had been holding talks over the last year about the unification of European markets, the single euro currency and globalisation of world financial markets. "We didn't progress beyond the point of exchanging views and ideas," he said.
The Belgian Trends weekly magazine earlier reported that Rabobank and Kredietbank were holding discrete talks, to be finalised in the summer, on forging a close alliance.
It said the banks were considering a form of co-operation similar to that of Fortis, which combines independent partners Fortis Amev and Fortis AG.
Referring to the report, De Kort told Reuters: "What is true is that we are talking to Kredietbank. What isn't true is the nature of the talks we are having."
He added that Rabobank was also holding talks today on the euro and other issues with other co-operative banks in Europe.
